Description: Limestone ostracon, with nineteen lines of black-painted demotic text on one side and a further fourteen lines on the other side.
Curator's comments: To be published by Brian Muhs, who comments 'it dates to the 3rd Century BC and comes from the site of Nag el-Mesheikh across the Nile from Abydos [from] an archive of temple accounts, receipts and orders for payment' (2006) Publication is in press (2018).
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (393418) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/393418)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Prof Francis W Kelsey (Syndicate)
